extractions.description: This paper introduces Geom3D, a unified benchmarking platform for symmetry-informed geometric representation models used in modeling molecules, proteins, and crystalline materials. Geom3D benchmarks 16 geometric models and 14 geometric pretraining methods over 46 datasets across various scientific domains. The main contribution is providing a unified, symmetry-informed geometric representation and extensive evaluation of various models and datasets.

title.value: Symmetry-Informed Geometric Representation for Molecules, Proteins, and Crystalline Materials
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Symmetry-Informed Geometric Representation for Molecules, Proteins, and Crystalline Materials

type.justification: The paper aims to benchmark existing geometric models and provides a comprehensive evaluation of their performance across multiple tasks and datasets, making it an empirical study.
type.quote: Nevertheless, pursuing geometric learning research is still challenging due to its evolving nature and the knowledge gap between science (e.g., physics) and machine learning communities. These factors contribute to a substantial barrier for machine learning researchers to investigate scientific problems and hinder efforts to reproduce results consistently. To overcome this, we introduce Geom3D, a benchmarking of the geometric representation with four advantages, as follows.

research_field.justification: The entire paper focuses on benchmarking and evaluating models used to learn geometric representations of data, which is central to geometric deep learning.
research_field.quote: Geom3D benchmarks 16 geometric models on solving 46 scientific tasks, and these tasks include the three most fundamental molecule types: small molecules, proteins, and crystalline materials.

sub_research_field.justification: The paper specifically studies geometric representations of molecules, proteins, and crystalline materials, making it a study in molecular and material modeling within the broader field of geometric deep learning.
sub_research_field.quote: Geom3D benchmarks 16 geometric models on solving 46 scientific tasks, and these tasks include the three most fundamental molecule types: small molecules, proteins, and crystalline materials.

name.justification: SchNet is explicitly mentioned as one of the models benchmarked in the paper.
name.quote: Invariant Model: SchNet, DimeNet, SphereNet, GemNet

type.justification: The paper classifies SchNet as an invariant model with respect to SE(3) group symmetry.

name.justification: The paper mentions that Geom3D is based on PyTorch Geometric (PyG).
name.quote: In this work, we propose Geom3D, a geometric modeling framework based on PyTorch Geometric (PyG), one of the most widely-used platforms for graph representation learning.
